medical_history.chief_complaint: 1 day history of vomiting, fever, and headache.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 day prior to admission with vomiting, fever, and headache. The patient was tachycardic and poorly perfused upon examination. There were signs of left-sided ptosis and a dilated non-reactive left pupil, with a Glasgow coma score of 8.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of autoimmunity, with systemic lupus erythematosus in the mother and hypothyroidism in the father.
